title: Yoko Teraoka
text:
Sho Miyazaki is a Research Fellow (predoctoral) at Stanford Graduate School of Business, mentored by Prof. Andrew Hall in Political Economics Group. With Prof. Hall, he is now analyzing the voting system of DAOs collecting data from blockchains.
He holds LL.B. from Keio University, where he studied political science (major), Japanese literature and arts (minor), and statistics. In AY 2020-21, he studied at Harvard College as a visiting student. Aftrer completing the Pre-Doc in 2025, he wants to proceed to Ph.D. Program in Computational Social Science.
His research focuses on the quantitative analysis of voting systems, particularly focus on political representation. Also, his interests expands to legislative redistricting, Web3, financial markets, and rugby football.
Outside Stanford, he is affiliated with the Algorithm-Assisted Redistricting Methodology (ALARM) Project, and awarded as Keio University Global Fellow 2023.



Stanford Graduate School of Business | Stanford, CA

Research Fellow (Predoctoral) | July 2023 - June 2025
Mentored by Prof. Andrew Hall

Keio University | Tokyo, Japan

LL.B. in Political Science | April 2019 - March 2023

Harvard College | Cambridge, MA

Visiting Undergraduate Student | August 2020 - May 2021

gggggggg
